column4: Hmm, yeah, this site also says that Breezy's driver for e1000 is outdated
http://blog.dataloss.nl/perma/ubuntu-510-breezy-on-dell-dimension-9150/
And it provides a compiled e1000.ko driver
But how do I get the Ubuntu installer to use this?
Will wget work though?  It's my network card that's not being recognized
I'm on my current Windows installation
Which I am intending to wipe when I install Ubuntu
hmm
I don't have a floppy drive
My other hard disk needs an IDE->SATA driver...well, I have an iPod ;)
i'm sorry ignore my smart(_!_) was j/k
That's the only USB drive I have right now
I could try to find someone's to borrow though.
Do you think my iPod would be recognized as a USB drive?
just glad you have a sense "O" humor...some don't ouch *ducks* "QUACK"
Heh
Yeah
I could do that
I could strip the one from my older computer
Now don't laugh at this, but do you mean recompiling the kernel?
And...is that difficult?
I'm familair with Linux/Unix systems but I've never recompiled the kernel
that is what I would do. I had some crazy 3com clone card made in japan and could not for life of me get it installed..$20 later I got smart :)
